title: How to Make Sweet Pea Soup

steps.headline: Fry the bacon in a soup pot until crispy in texture.
steps.description: Drain the bacon on paper towels and set aside until garnishing.

steps.headline: Measure and pour the oil and flour into the same pot.
Add the leeks to the pot and continue to stir for an additional 3 minutes.
Add the peas and stock to the pot.
Bring the mixture to a boil and lower the heat.
steps.description: Let everything simmer for about 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Puree the mixture in an immersion blender, food processor, or blender.
steps.description: Achieve a smooth texture and pour it back in the pot.

steps.headline: Add the cream and salt & pepper to taste.
Serve the soup and garnish each bowl with bacon and red peppers.
In a large cooking pot, melt the butter under medium heat.
steps.description: Use a fork to swab the butter all over the pan. It should take about thirty seconds or less to melt. Pour in your chopped onion  pieces into the frying pan and have it brown for about three to four minutes.

steps.headline: Slowly pour the broth once things are steaming.
steps.description: Stir in the rest of the ingredients: the peas, sugar, mint, salt, and extra seasonings for your taste. Have it cook for about 5 minutes so the peas and broth can heat up.

steps.headline: Remove the pot from heat and shut stove off.
steps.description: Pour soup in a blender or food processor. Close using a lid and start blending slowly and then quickly on high. If needed, cover lid with a towel to avoid spills or messes.

steps.headline: Pour mashed pea soup back in pot and have it heat up to your liking.
steps.description: Once done, insert pea soup into bowls, tea cups, or mugs using a ladle. Garnish with desired ingredients or with lemon juice and extra seasonings if needed.

text: Method 1 Fry the bacon in a soup pot until crispy in texture. Drain the bacon on paper towels and set aside until garnishing. Measure and pour the oil and flour into the same pot. Stir for 3 minutes. Add the leeks to the pot and continue to stir for an additional 3 minutes.  Add the peas and stock to the pot.  Bring the mixture to a boil and lower the heat. Let everything simmer for about 30 minutes. Puree the mixture in an immersion blender, food processor, or blender. Achieve a smooth texture and pour it back in the pot. Add the cream and salt & pepper to taste.  Serve the soup and garnish each bowl with bacon and red peppers.  Method 2 In a large cooking pot, melt the butter under medium heat. Use a fork to swab the butter all over the pan. It should take about thirty seconds or less to melt. Pour in your chopped onion  pieces into the frying pan and have it brown for about three to four minutes. Slowly pour the broth once things are steaming. Stir in the rest of the ingredients: the peas, sugar, mint, salt, and extra seasonings for your taste. Have it cook for about 5 minutes so the peas and broth can heat up. Remove the pot from heat and shut stove off. Pour soup in a blender or food processor. Close using a lid and start blending slowly and then quickly on high. If needed, cover lid with a towel to avoid spills or messes. Pour mashed pea soup back in pot and have it heat up to your liking. Once done, insert pea soup into bowls, tea cups, or mugs using a ladle. Garnish with desired ingredients or with lemon juice and extra seasonings if needed.
